solution.text:
Area of the wrapper= TSA of the ice cream
We can say the TSA of a ice cream= CSA of cylinder + CSA of the (scoop)hemispheres
CSA of the hemisphere is given by \(2 \times \pi \times r^2\)
we have radius(r) of the hemisphere=radius of the cone=_{k}_
therefore area of a hemisphere=\(2 \times \pi \times _{k}_^2=_{{trunc(2*pi_val*k*k,2)}}_\)
Now area of a cone=\(\pi \times r \times l\)
slant height of the cone=\(l=_{j}_\)
Therefore area of the cone=\(\pi \times _{k}_ \times _{j}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*k*j,2)}}_\)
TSA of a Capsule= CSA of cone + CSA of the hemispheres=\(_{{trunc(pi_val*k*j,2)}}_+ _{{trunc(2*pi_val*k*k,2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(pi_val*k*j+2*pi_val*k*k,2)}}_\)
